org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.workers

Class WorkerPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.workers.WorkerPool

  • @ThreadSafe
public class WorkerPool
extends Object
    A managed pool of Linode workers, on which commands may be executed remotely via SSH.

    Linode Naming Convention

    A worker pool has a group name, which is used as the Linode display group for workers. See setGroupName() for group naming requirements. The group name is also a unique naming prefix for all workers in the pool. For example, if the worker pool group name is "My-Worker-Pool" then worker Linodes will be named "My-Worker-Pool-1", "My-Worker-Pool-2", etc.

    All Linodes with other names are ignored. However on startup, any workers in the pool that already exist (identified by their names) are automatically detected and added as members of the pool. This allows a worker pool's Linodes to persist across restarts of a WorkerPool instance.

    Pool Size

    Workers are added to the pool via invocations of addWorker(). Workers are never automatically added; however, idle workers (those with no remaining Processes) are automatically shutdown after a configurable maximum idle time, until the configurable minimum number of workers is reached.

    Managed vs. Unmanaged Workers

    Workers are normally expected to follow specific state transitions as they are created, utilized, and shutdown. If a worker is seen doing something unexpected, it transitions to Worker.State.UNMANAGED. In particular, once a worker is created, it is expected to become Linode.Status.RUNNING within the configured maximum startup time; similarly, when a worker is destroyed, it is expected to disappear within the configured maximum shutdown time. Workers can also be manually controlled via Worker.setUnmanaged() and Worker.setManaged().

    If a Worker's Linode disappears unexpectedly (including the situation where a new Linode with the same name but different ID replaces it), the Worker becomes Worker.State.INVALID and is removed from the pool. If a WorkerPool is stop()ped, all remaining workers immediately become Worker.State.INVALID. A worker in the Worker.State.INVALID is no longer associated with its WorkerPool instance. Use getWorkers() to inspect and monitor the current workers.

    In general, WorkerPools are robust in the face of unexpected behavior. This allows humans to intervene when needed. For example, if a worker is misbehaving or needs to be inspected by a human, you can invoke Worker.setUnmanaged(), rename the worker in the Linode console, or shut it down.

      • DEFAULT_MAX_STARTUP_TIME_SECONDS

        public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_STARTUP_TIME_SECONDS
        Default maximum time (in seconds) for a newly created worker to be up and running (600).

        If startup takes longer than this, the worker reverts to Worker.State.UNMANAGED.

        See Also:

        If shutdown takes longer than this, the worker reverts to Worker.State.UNMANAGED.

        public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_IDLE_TIME_SECONDS
        Default maximum idle time (in seconds) before shutting down idle workers (300).

        An idle worker is one with zero active Processes running on it.

    • Method Detail

      • getGroupName

        public String getGroupName()
        Get the name of the worker Linode group.
        Returns:
        worker Linode group name

      • setGroupName

        public void setGroupName(String groupName)
        Configure the name of the Linode group in which to put workers.

        This setting also determines the name of each worker, by taking the group name and adding the worker index as a suffix. For example, if the group name is "My-Workers" then the worker Linodes will be named "My-Workers-1", "My-Workers-2", etc.

        The only allowed characters are ASCII letters, digits, dashes, and underscores. The name must start and end in a letter or digit, and each dash or underscore must be surrounded by a letter or digit.

        The default group name is "Worker-Pool".

        Parameters:
        groupName - worker Linode group
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if groupName is invalid
        IllegalStateException - if this instance is already start()ed

      • getMinWorkers

        public int getMinWorkers()
        Get the minimum number of workers to keep alive in the worker pool, even if idle.

        Default is 0.

        Returns:
        minumum number of workers to keep around

      • getMaxStartupTime

        public int getMaxStartupTime()
        Get the maximum time to wait for a newly created worker to become up and running.

        If startup takes longer than this, the worker reverts to Worker.State.UNMANAGED.

        Default is 600 seconds.

        Returns:
        maxumum worker startup time in seconds

        If shutdown takes longer than this, the worker reverts to Worker.State.UNMANAGED.

        Default is 300 seconds.

      • getMaxIdleTime

        public int getMaxIdleTime()
        Get the max idle time for an idle worker before destroying it.

        When a worker has zero processes for this long, and there are more than the minimum number of workers, then it will be destroyed.

        Default is 300 seconds.

        Returns:
        maxumum worker idle time in seconds

      • setStandardRootPassword

        public void setStandardRootPassword(String standardRootPassword)
        Configure a standard root password to use for all newly created worker Linodes.

        Setting this property allows use of root password authentication with Linode workers that are already in existence when this worker pool starts, assuming they were in fact created with the same root password.

        If this property is left unset, newly created workers will get a random auto-generated root password.

        In any case, the root password for a worker, if known, is available via Worker.getRootPassword().

        Parameters:
        standardRootPassword - standard root password
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this instance is already start()ed

      • getStandardSshFlags

        public List<String> getStandardSshFlags()
        Get the standard set of SSH flags used for all remote executions.
        Returns:
        mutable copy of the standard ssh flags

      • setStandardSshFlags

        public void setStandardSshFlags(List<String> standardSshFlags)
        Configure the standard set of SSH flags used for all remote executions.

        Default flags are: -2xaT --oServerAliveInterval=10 -oServerAliveCountMax=6 -oTCPKeepAlive=yes.

        Note these flags are always included first; any additional per-execution flags passed in the sshFlags parameter to Worker.execute() are appended to this list.

        Parameters:
        standardSshFlags - standard ssh flags
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this instance is already start()ed
        IllegalArgumentException - if standardSshFlags is null

      • getWorkerNamePrefix

        public String getWorkerNamePrefix()
        Get the common Linode name prefix which is derived from the group name.

        All workers in a worker pool with group name "My-Worker-Pool" with have a common Linode prefix "My-Worker-Pool-". The suffix is the worker's index in the pool.

        Returns:
        worker name prefix

      • getWorkerFilter

        public Filter getWorkerFilter()
        Get a Linode API query filter that matches all of this instance's workers.

        The filter is guaranteed not to produce false negatives, but it may produce false positives. In other words, querying with this filter returns all workers in the pool but also possibly other Lindoes as well.

        Returns:
        worker name filter

      • addWorker

        public Worker addWorker(String regionId,
                        String typeId,
                        String imageId)
        Add a new worker.

        This method executes synchronously to create the Linode, blocking on network I/O if necessary.

        If no standard root password is configured, a random root password will be auto-generated via generateRandomPassword().

        Parameters:
        regionId - Linode region ID
        typeId - Linode type ID
        imageId - Linode image ID
        Returns:
        newly added worker
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this instance is not start()ed
        RestClientException - if an error occurs

      • addWorker

        public Worker addWorker(String regionId,
                        String typeId,
                        String imageId,
                        int backupId,
                        int stackScriptId,
                        Map<String,String> stackScriptData,
                        List<String> authorizedKeys)
        Add a new worker.

        This method executes synchronously to create the Linode, blocking on network I/O if necessary.

        If no standard root password is configured, a random root password will be auto-generated via generateRandomPassword().

        Parameters:
        regionId - Linode region ID
        typeId - Linode type ID
        imageId - Linode image ID or null for none (must be null if backupId is not -1)
        backupId - Linode backup ID or -1 for none (must be -1 if imageId is non-null)
        stackScriptId - StackScript ID or -1 for none
        stackScriptData - StackScript variable data or null for none
        authorizedKeys - SSH public keys to pre-install, or null for none
        Returns:
        newly added worker
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this instance is not start()ed
        RestClientException - if an error occurs

      • start

        @PostConstruct
public void start()
        Start this instance.

        Does nothing if already started.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no LinodeApiRequestSender is configured
        IllegalStateException - if no AsyncTaskExecutor is configured
        IllegalStateException - if no TaskScheduler is configured

      • stop

        @PreDestroy
public void stop()
        Stop this instance.

        This method does not destroy the remaining workers. Use Worker.destroy() to do that prior to invoking this method.

        After this method is invoked, any remaining workers will have been moved to the Worker.State.INVALID state.

      • destroy

        protected boolean destroy(Worker worker)
        Schedule the specified worker for destruction.
        Parameters:
        worker - worker to destroy
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if worker is already in state Worker.State.DESTROYING, or is in state Worker.State.INVALID

      • checkSshConnectivity

        protected void checkSshConnectivity(Worker worker)
                             throws IOException
        Check for SSH connectivity.

        Linodes reach the Linode.Status.RUNNING status as soon as they are booted, but the sshd(8) daemon does not start listening for connections until several seconds later. The purpose of this method is to check whether sshd(8) is ready.

        The implementation in WorkerPool simply attempts to connect to TCP port 22.

        Parameters:
        worker - worker to check
        Throws:
        IOException - if the check fails
